intro: Spigelia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in spring, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Spigelia macrophylla is typically found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade.
